data.text:
Heidenstam, Verner von. THE CHARLES MEN ... Translated from the Swedish by Charles Wharton Stork. With an Introduction by Fredrik Book. New York: The American-Scandinavian Foundation. London: Humphrey Milford Oxford University Press, 1920. Octavo, two volumes, original decorated maroon cloth stamped in gold. First edition. Printed by D. B. Updike at The Merrymount Press. The author, a Swedish aristocrat (1859-1940), won the Nobel Prize in 1916 after a career touching many fields of literature. The stories in the present volume, portraits of contemporary Swedish life, were originally published in 1897-1898. Spine ends and corner tips lightly rubbed, a bright, near fine set. (#117448).

Price: $65.00
